intro: Diodia mello-barretoi, commonly known as the Brazilian daisy, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers that bloom in shades of yellow and white. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sunlight, making it suitable for cultivation in warm climates. Its ornamental value has led to its use in gardens and as a cut flower.
